chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Set
A1: A
A0: A
eqA: A -> A -> Prop
plusA: A -> A -> A
invA: A -> A
multA: A -> A -> A
minusA: A -> A -> A
divA: A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A
cs: CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA
eqA_dec: forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b}
n: nat
ltM: mon n -> mon n -> Prop
ltM_dec: forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b}
os: OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n)

Goal:
forall (Q : list (poly A0 eqA ltM)) (s t : list (Term A n)), reduceplus Q s t -> canonical A0 eqA ltM s -> forall p q : list (Term A n), eqP A eqA n s (pluspf A0 (eqA:=eqA) plusA eqA_dec (ltM:=ltM) ltM_dec p q) -> canonical A0 eqA ltM p -> canonical A0 eqA ltM q -> eqP A eqA n t (pO A n) -> exists r1 : list (Term A n), reduceplus Q p r1 /\ reduceplus Q q (mults multA (n:=n) (invTerm invA (n:=n) (T1 A1 n)) r1)

Premises:
zero_mon : forall d : nat, mon d
Inductive mon : nat -> Set := n_0 : mon 0 | c_n : forall d : nat, nat -> mon d -> mon (S d) Arguments mon _%nat_scope Arguments c_n (_ _)%nat_scope
mults : forall A : Set, (A -> A -> A) -> forall n : nat, Term A n -> list (Term A n) -> list (Term A n)
mult_mon : forall d : nat, mon d -> mon d -> mon d
pO : forall (A : Set) (n : nat), list (Term A n)
Record Q : Set := Qmake { Qnum : BinNums.Z; Qden : BinNums.positive } Arguments QArith_base.Qmake _%Z_scope _%positive_scope
poly : forall A : Set, A -> (A -> A -> Prop) -> forall n : nat, (mon n -> mon n -> Prop) -> Set

canonical : forall A : Set, A -> (A -> A -> Prop) -> forall n : nat, (mon n -> mon n -> Prop) -> list (Term A n) -> Prop

Inductive reduceplus (Q : list (poly A0 eqA ltM)) : list (Term A n) -> list (Term A n) -> Prop := Rstar_0 : forall x y : list (Term A n), eqP A eqA n x y -> reduceplus Q x y | Rstar_n : forall x y z : list (Term A n), reduce A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec Q x y -> reduceplus Q y z -> reduceplus Q x z Arguments reduceplus (_ _ _)%list_scope Arguments Rstar_0 (_ _ _)%list
